result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis F. Farmer

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on December 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

(Case called at 3:36 PM)Defendant 
Travis F. Farmer in court without counsel.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's attorney had to recently withdraw - Public Defender Office is in the process of appointing a new attorney to the case.
Arraignment: December 1, 2022 at 1:45 PM

Conditions:
No contact with G.S. or G.S. residence.
Arraignment on October 27, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

2:24 PM cases 21CF1159, 21CM60, 22CF589, 22CM159 called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Travis F. Farmer in court, in custody with Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached. 

State moves to modify bond in 22CF589 from $3,000 cash to $3,000 signature bond. So ordered. 

2:30 PM off the record

2:43 PM back on the record

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

Defendant pleads No Contest in 21CF1159 Count 2: Disorderly Conduct without Domestic Abuse Enhancer. 

Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty

Court orders: 30 days jail with 30 days credit, restitution $197.18 plus 10% surcharge as civil judgment from dismissed and read in case 21CM60, court costs, provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in including 22CM159, 21CM60. Jury trial removed from calendar. 

Branch 5 for scheduling in 22CF589.

Conditions:
No contact with G.S. or G.S. residence.
Preliminary Hearing, 07/19/2022
Arraignment/Initial Appearance, 06/21/2022
Motion hearing on August 30, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

2:29 PM cases 21CF1159, 21CM60, 22CF589, 21CF1159 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis F. Farmer in court, in custody.  Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk in court for Travis F. Farmer. Defense presents a motion for the Court. State asks for a motion be set rather than address today- no proper notice. 
State addresses discovery- Defendant has been provided all the Discovery that the State has. 
Attorney Van Daalwyk has filed a motion to withdraw- Defendant objects to Defense to withdraw. Court denies Defense's motion to withdraw. 
Court has a colloquy with defendant regarding the process in which to request discovery and transcripts. 
Court has a colloquy regarding his communication with his attorney. 

A motion hearing is scheduled for 08/30/2022 at 2:15 PM.
to Withdraw as Counsel
of Attorney Jansen Van Daalwyk

Prior: 50 E Spruce Street, Chippewa County Jail, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729 United States
Same as Complaint.

(1:50 PM cases 21CM60, 21CF1159, 22CM159, 22CF589 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Travis F. Farmer in court, in custody. Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk in court for Travis F. Farmer.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Parties advise are ready to proceed with case 22CF589.
State calls Officer Sandy Bautch of the Altoona Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
State moves to admit exhibit #1, no objection by Attorney Van Daalwyk. Court orders exhibit #1 is received.
Attorney Jansen Van Daalwyk conducts cross-examination of Officer Bautch. Witness excused.
State moves for bind over. Attorney Van Daalwyk motions the court to not find probable cause.
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over.
Attorney Van Daalwyk requests to be heard on bond. State is willing to hear bond argument.
Attorney Van Daalwyk makes argument for bond reduction. State makes argument opposing bond reduction.
Court orders motion for bond modification is denied.
Court notes a status conference is currently scheduled in Branch 1 for August 18, 2022 at 2:30 pm in case 21CF1159 and all cases to track with for that date and time.
Notice of Hearing - Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward
Letter dated 7/14/22 from Attorney Van Daalwyk to COC with Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jansen Van Daalwyk at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $35 beginning 07/24/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:31 PM cases 21CF1159, 21CM60, 22CF589, 22CM159 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis F. Farmer in court, in custody. Attorney Brian Braziel appears in court for the defendant. There is a conflict with Attorney Braziel representing the defendant and he needs to withdraw. Defendant makes a statement regarding the length of time he's been incarcerated. State responds. Defendant responds. Court permits Attorney Braziel to withdraw. Defendant would like to address bond- State objects to bond modification. Court will address bond at next hearing. County to appoint a new attorney. 
All matters are adjourned until next week. Preliminary hearings are scheduled for 7/19/22 at 1:30 PM.
It is ordered that Attorney Brian Braziel is withdrawn as counsel.

Attorney Brian Braziel at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $35 beginning 07/24/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.
It is ordered that Attorney Robert Thorson is withdrawn as counsel.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
SPD Appointment - Attorney Robert Thorson

3:25 PM Cases called: 21CF1159, 21CM60, 22CF589 & 22CM159. Defendant Travis F. Farmer appeared by video, in custody from the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant has applied for the Court Appointed Attorney and the Defendant also qualifies for Public Defender representation. Public Defender Office has not been able to find counsel as of yet. Defendant would like to be represented. Court finds good cause to extend the time limits for the preliminary hearing. 

A new Preliminary hearing date is set. Defendant would like to be heard on bond. Court indicates bond can be heard at preliminary hearing date.

Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency (*Does qualify for Public Defender, so no SPD denial form attached.)
Received via USPS Mail, 06/27/2022.

(Cases 22CF589, 22CM159, 21CF1159, 21CM60 are called at 2:29 PM- by Zoom) Defendant Travis F. Farmer appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court has discussion with Defendant regarding right to an attorney. Defendant indicates he intends to file a speedy trial demand. State requests 21CM60 be called today to track along for scheduling. 
Defendant enters Not Guilty pleas in 21CF1159. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. Court orders a Jury Trial be scheduled in 21CF1159 within 90 days. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint in 22CF589. Defendant updates address. State requests $3,000 cash bond in 22CF589 (previously set in 22CM159, 21CF1159). Defendant objects and makes argument. Victim L.S. makes a statement. 
Court orders $3,000.00 cash bond with various conditions- Previously set in 22CM159, 21CF1159 to include 22CF589. 
Preliminary Hearing in 22CF589: 06/28/2022 at 2:30 PM. (22CM159, 21CF1159, 21CM60 to ride along) 
Court orders the clerk of courts to provide Defendant a copy of the petition for county appointed attorney.

Order approving Zoom appearance for victim for 06/21/2022 hearing. 
See Order for further details.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.
